stories.headline: Artex Questions for testimonials

latest_response.question: What benefits or perks offered by Artex do you find most valuable?
latest_response.answer: One of the benefits I enjoy most from Artex Gibraltar is the opportunity to play golf at the Alcaidesa course. I love being able to use their facilities and engage in outdoor sports. I think it's a fantastic idea that we can use it as employees, as it really motivates me and helps me feel completely recharged by Monday.

stories.headline: Latam Sebastian - Mentorship and Guidance - Navigating the Future together

latest_response.question: Describe a memorable moment where your guidance significantly impacted a mentee's development?
latest_response.answer:
One memorable moment that stands out occurred when I was mentoring a colleague who was struggling with transitioning into a leadership role. He had the technical expertise and the work ethic, but he was unsure of how to manage a team effectively and build the right relationships with his colleagues. This lack of confidence was holding him back from fully embracing his leadership responsibilities.

During our sessions, I focused on helping him navigate the softer skills required in leadership, such as effective communication, conflict resolution, and building trust within their team. However, the turning point came when we discussed the importance of vulnerability as a leader. I encouraged him to be open with their team about his own learning curve.

Not only did he begin to feel more comfortable in his role, but his team also started responding more positively, opening up with new ideas and taking more initiative.

written.content:

As the Vice President of Gallagher's Bogotá office, I have the privilege of leading a talented team and overseeing all strategic aspects of our local business. With a background in client relationship management and financial risk solutions, I joined Gallagher seven years ago, bringing with me a deep commitment to client satisfact

Without the guidance and companionship offered by these people and in general all those in the company, it would not have been able to grow as time goes by.

latest_response.question: How did you push through and created a momentum to keep moving forward?
latest_response.answer:
If there’s one thing my journey has taught me, it’s this—growth happens when you step outside your comfort zone. There will always be challenges, but they are simply steppingstones to something greater.
I believed in myself, even when doubt creeps in. Seek opportunities that excite me. Surround myself with people who uplift and challenge me. And most importantly, never stop pushing forward.

stories.headline: Tom Crehan: A day in the life of Senior Claims Investigator

latest_response.question: Can you share a success story/proudest achievement at Gallagher Bassett with us?
latest_response.answer: My proudest achievement working with Gallagher Bassett was when I received the Claims Investigator of the Year award. I had been in my second year of employment, and although not a Senior Claims Investigator yet, I had expressed my interest in taking on more complex cases and projects. My manager trusted in me, and we worked together on a complex insurance fraud network operating in the United States. After weeks of investigating, we submitted our efforts to our client who then submitted it to the State’s Attorney General’s Office for prosecution. Later that year I received the award for my efforts in the project, as well as my overall investigations throughout the year. This recognition and award showed my manager’s trust in my and showed Gallagher will reward those who work hard.

latest_response.answer: See previous response

stories.headline: UK Video series - Ipswich

latest_response.question: What do you find most rewarding about connecting with clients?

video.transcribe_text: Engaging with clients and building relationships where we become reliable partners and trusted advisors to them is hugely rewarding. Friendships are built, and it's through problem solving and overcoming challenges that you get the greatest satisfaction from what you do. It can be as simple as supporting a client when there's an emergency or an accident through to a team session building and innovating new ways to deal with emerging risks.

stories.headline: Building capability within your recruitment team through training programmes

latest_response.question: What are the key components of an effective recruitment training program?
latest_response.answer:
Great recruitment training looks very similar to great sales training programs. Probably not like sales training you might see on social media about “waking up at 4 AM to eat 37 egg whites and SLAY THOSE LEADS. ” Moreso, let's focus on how to create human connections and make people comfortable enough to have a conversation.

The basics include product/company knowledge, fact finding and needs analysis, effective communication, objection handling, negotiation tactics, closing techniques, and building relationships. Next up, the tools you need to make yourself as efficient as possible and how to be a good steward in those systems with your team. Lastly, honing those soft skills to ensure you can stand out in a competitive market.

stories.headline: Latam Ernesto Aldunce - Mentorship and Guidance - Navigating the Future together

latest_response.question: How do you tailor your mentoring approach to fit the unique needs and goals of each mentee?
latest_response.answer:
Each apprentice, each new member of Gallagher, has a different way of learning, to which I must adapt. It should be understood that I must provide the necessary knowledge to the apprentice so that he achieves the objectives of the organization within the area to which he has been assigned. 
That said, I have to adapt my inductions and teaching times to each apprentice, but the focus is never lost, which is to provide the tools that the apprentice will need to perform efficiently in the organization and, in this way, that the apprentice meets the objectives of Gallagher Retail.

stories.headline: Latam - Gabriela Perez's Internal Job Mobility - Navigating the future together

latest_response.question: What motivated you to pursue internal job opportunities at Gallagher, and how did you navigate the process?
latest_response.answer:
My biggest motivation was to feel that I was in a growing company, with a family seal and where opportunities could be generated. Here people are trusted, their abilities and development.

My entire process was approached with hard work, dedication and resilience.

stories.headline: From [Previous Role] to [Current Role]: [Name]'s Gallagher Career Journey

latest_response.question: What motivated you to pursue upskilling opportunities at Gallagher, and how did you identify the skills you wanted to develop?
latest_response.answer: I am naturally a person with drive and always wanted to evolve and learn new aspects of the business. It just makes any job more interesting and also leaves you with feeling of accomplishment. I am still trying to improve my writing skills since English is my second language.

stories.headline: Latam Felipe - Career Development - Growth for the Go-getter

latest_response.question: What advice would you give to someone new at Gallagher who is looking to develop their skills and knowledge?
latest_response.answer:
Gallagher is a company that listens to and cares about the concerns of its employees. It is an organization where enthusiasm for what we do is evident; we always strive for more and share a common goal: to find the best strategy to deliver excellent service to our clients.

The intranet offers a wide range of development materials, with courses that are very comprehensive and educational. They are highly recommended and available for everyone to learn at their own pace.

Furthermore, if we identify a course that could be beneficial for both the employee and the company, Gallagher is willing to listen and provide support. They have done so with me, and I am very grateful for it.

We should not fear proposing growth opportunities, especially in a company of Gallagher's size and global presence, where opportunities are plentiful. It is up to each individual to motivate themselves, get organized, and propose a development project.

Motivation must always start from within.

written.content:
From Classroom to Boardroom: Learning Beyond the Numbers
Hi there! I'm thrilled to share my experience at Gallagher and how the company has supported me in pursuing learning opportunities that have enhanced my career growth. As a leader in the Mergers and Acquisitions (M&A), I've had the privilege of working with a fantastic team focused on identifying potential acquisition opportunities and ensur

stories.headline: Latam - Internal Job Mobility - Navigating the future together

latest_response.question: If you could offer one piece of advice to someone looking to make a similar internal move, what would it be?
latest_response.answer:
My advice would be to take the opportunity without thinking twice. It’s a unique opportunity that will drive both personal and professional growth at the same time.

Additionally, I would recommend having an open mindset and being willing to adapt to new ways of working and learn from others. Constant communication and teamwork are key to integrating quickly and being successful in the new role. Finally, having a positive and proactive attitude, always showing your commitment and willingness to contribute, will make your transition much smoother and more fulfilling.

stories.headline: Latam - Commitment to Excellence - The Unwavering Gallagher Way

latest_response.question: Have you faced any challenges or setbacks in maintaining high standards? How did you use creativity or resilience to champion them?
latest_response.answer:
I think that every day there are challenges in meeting standards, because we are many people working towards a common business objective. 

The constancy in doing things well and being committed to the values ​​of the Gallagher way allow us to meet the standards of excellence, as there is a permanent focus on the client, on the service we deliver, on satisfying their needs and above all on doing it in the best way, professionally and ethically. Every day we must remember the reason for our company's existence so that resilience is always maintained.

stories.headline: Latam - Team Collaboration and Support - Navigating the Future Together

latest_response.question: If your team were a superhero squad, what would each member’s superpower be, and how would it contribute to your team's success?
latest_response.answer:
Felipe Pescador: X-ray vision, because it allows him to have a vision of proposed changes, enabling the team to be mobilized with proper leadership. 
Roberto Herrera: Mind reading, because he has a great ability to analyze the people around him, which allows him to build trust relationships and assign tasks according to their capabilities, improving each team member's results. 
Alejandro Bernal: Time control, because he manages to organize the activities of different teams, allowing them to meet the established schedules to achieve the objectives set for each project.
Jessica Fajardo: Super speed, because she has an amazing ability to understand the process being analyzed to achieve its optimization, leveraging less time in analysis, developing improvement ideas in short times, reducing project deployment times.
 Kevin Patiño: Regeneration, he has a great ability to overcome difficult situations, such as frustration in change management, thinking of new techniques to mobilize the team to achieve the expected results.

stories.headline: Latam - Mentorship and Guidance - Navigating the future together

latest_response.question: If you could as a mentor possess a 'superpower', what would it be and why?
latest_response.answer:
If I could possess a superpower as a mentor, it would be the ability to instantly understand and empathize with the unique needs, challenges, and aspirations of each individual I mentor. This superpower would allow me to instantly tap into their thought processes, motivations, and emotional states, enabling me to provide guidance that is perfectly tailored to them in any given moment. 

This superpower would not only foster a deeper connection and trust between mentor and mentee but also empower the mentee to achieve their goals more effectively. By understanding their personal journey, I could offer insights and strategies that align with their individual growth and development, ultimately guiding them to navigate their future with confidence and clarity.

stories.headline: Latam - Career Development - Growth for the go-getter

latest_response.question: Can you walk us through your journey at Gallagher and talk about your current role briefly?
latest_response.answer:
I began my career at Gallagher two years ago as a commercial practitioner. From the outset, I noticed that it was a company with a vision of solid growth, focused on service sustainability and, above all, flexible and open to listening to everyone's ideas. This culture, combined with the willingness and excellent treatment of people, motivated me to be proactively involved, even without previous insurance experience, providing ideas and supporting the team with a very good attitude.

My initial role was to provide support to the sales team, helping them to structure tenders and develop tools for sales. Over time, the team expanded and we went from being just me to having three members. Gallagher was able to identify my key competencies and, together, we created a development plan. This allowed me to evolve from a purely operational and back office job to assuming greater field responsibilities and direct interaction with clients.

Currently, my position focuses on serving as a facilitator between different areas and, at the same time, maintaining contact with clients. This growth has been part of a strategic plan that seeks to train me as an integral professional, capable of managing both operational and commercial aspects, thus providing a better service and contributing to the success of the organization.

stories.headline: Growth for the go-getter: Entrepreneurial Spirit_McLee Smith

latest_response.question: How has Gallagher’s environment or culture supported your entrepreneurial efforts?
latest_response.answer:
Gallagher's focus on our people as our enduring strength align very well with my approach.  In addition, our openness to change has been critical as we push to accomplish our organizational and personal goals. 
The culture of collaboration and support from colleagues encourages a shared vision, fostering an innovative environment where entrepreneurial ideas can thrive. Additionally, Gallagher's investment in resources empowers individuals to take initiative and drive their projects forward with confidence.

written.content:
Entrepreneurial Leadership: Transforming Challenges to Growth 
In my last 5 years as an Area President at Gallagher, I've had the privilege of witnessing firsthand the power of a business mindset in driving expansion and creating value for our clients. Throughout my journey, I've learned that success isn't just about chasing revenue; it's about fostering a culture that supports innovation, adaptab

stories.headline: Kenya - BHM Campaign

latest_response.question: What unique experiences from your time at an HBCU have you brought with you to your career?
latest_response.answer: The most unique experiences from my time at NCAT were the multiple memories of community being formed. At every turn I saw an opportunity to either create a community or be a part of one. Organizations like; SGA (Student Government Association), American Marketing Association, Aggie Ambassadors, and MLT (Management Leadership for Tomorrow) were all opportunities presenting community. Community where I was not only accepted for being myself but also pushed to elevate and be the best version of myself. NCAT is definitely an environment where anyone can explore different passions, hobbies, or even get closer to their roots and be themselves. While also working towards being the best they can be. I have brought the experience of community into my career every chance I've got. Through always creating a safe space for everyone. Ensuring that everyone on my team and beyond can always feel confident to be themselves at work while also pushing them towards their goals.

written.content:
HBCU to Gallagher: Navigating Success Through Community, Growth, and Teamwork

As a proud alumna of the illustrious North Carolina A&T State University (NCAT), the experiences at my HBCU have shaped my understanding of community, teamwork, and the importance of being true to oneself. I've carried these values

stories.headline: The Unwavering Gallagher Way: Leadership + Ethical Practices

latest_response.question: If you could create a fictional “Leadership Code of Ethics” for Gallagher, what would be the first rule, and why?
latest_response.answer: Lead by example with authenticity. Actions speak louder than words. Gallagher's leaders should embody the values and principles they wish to instill in their teams, creating a transparent and trustworthy environment. By being genuine and consistent in their behavior, leaders can inspire and motivate others to uphold ethical standards and contribute positively to the organization's culture.

written.content:
Ethical Leadership in Action: Empathy and Integrity
At Gallagher, ethical leadership is at the heart of our culture. It's about making decisions that reflect our core values and creating an environment where every team member feels empowered to contribute to our shared success. Join me as I reflect on my 25-year journey at Gallagher and share how we, as leaders, navigate the intersection of busine

stories.headline: Lee's Mentorship Story: Navigating the Future Together

latest_response.question: If you could give your mentee a 'superpower' for their career development, what would it be and why?
latest_response.answer: It's how to read a job advert! There's loads of data out there, both in studies at universities, as well as from the variety of suppliers I work with. And there is one irrevocable truth. When reading the minimum criteria in a job description, the majority of it doesn't matter. There. I said it, again, but this time in writing. Too many people especially people new to the world of work believe they must tick every box. The sad reality is that is EXACTLY what is holding them back. Chances are that nobody hold ALL those skills the employer is looking for, and they will have to drop the less important ones - and those are all the missed opportunities, for every employee to progress and move their careers forward.

stories.headline: Lee Morris - BHM Campaign

latest_response.question: How do you see Gallagher supporting your growth and career development?
latest_response.answer: Gallagher has always been at the forefront in providing opportunities for professional development and a broad networking landscape. Their platform supporting diversity initiatives in conjunction with career development allows for me to participate in Early Talent Recruitment on HBCU campuses, specifically my Alma Mater, Grambling St. University. It’s a great benefit for career growth to connect with colleagues, alumni and other industry leaders for discussions on partnerships and branding to further enhance not just my experience but the experiences of other Gallagher employees and future employees.

stories.headline: Nigel - BHM Campaign

latest_response.question: What attracted you to Gallagher, and how does the company’s culture align with your values?
latest_response.answer: At first I knew nothing about Gallagher outside of the name and now I find myself wanting to start a career there, but it all started with a simple connection. Gallagher was among other options for me at the time, but what made choose them over the rest was because my mother knew somebody who worked at a branch and I didn't want to pass up an opportunity to add them to my network. Since joining, I've found that Gallagher and I share the desire to work with good people. You don't get to pick who your coworkers are, and sometimes you get somebody who brings more negativity than anything to the workplace, but Gallagher doesn't hire negative people. If the hiring managers can't see themselves working with negative people, even if they're good at the job, they'll pass them up for someone positive and uplifting instead.

stories.headline: BHM Campaign: HBCU Experience and African Americans & Labor

latest_response.question: Can you share any experiences where you felt particularly supported or valued as an HBCU graduate at Gallagher?
latest_response.answer: Absolutely! Six years ago, my close friend/classmate and another young lady were faced with the challenge of the closure of our high school under the University system where we grew up due to limited funding. We were able to secure approval to convert the school to a charter designation and a $40M building structure. It saved the educational experiences for over 400 K-12 students in the community. Upon discussing this endeavor with my then Area President, Luke Kaplan, not only did he create additional awareness within our division, but that exposure also led to additional publicity outside of Gallagher in the form of mentorships and other volunteer led initiatives that enhanced the experiences of kids who greatly appreciated the investment in their future.  Also, during that conversation, Luke connected me with the Early Talent Team that created an accelerated HBCU recruiting focus starting with Grambling St. University. This opened the doors for discussions on future sales and risk management major inclusions Grambling State’s College of Business program as well as recruiting at other HBCUs. By merely putting a spotlight on an accomplishment in the K-12 sector within a small community, it led to other valuable conversations and growth within sectors that showed kids that they were truly seen as citizens of the world. The support that was provided through Luke’s leadership was far beyond what I imagined as it showed me that those things that I valued outside of the work world was also supported within my work world. This let me know that Gallaher is interested in me for more than as an employee. The are interested in me as an extension of the Gallagher tenet that “we support one another…we believe in one another’

stories.headline: I&D: The Unwavering Gallagher Way - Custom Employee Story

advocates.role: VP Business Systems Integration, GGB Americas

latest_response.question: What does an inclusive and respectful culture at Gallagher mean to you, and how do you see it reflected in your daily work life?
latest_response.answer:
It means not having to live a stereotypical “bro culture” to succeed in today’s business world. It means we can still be competitive, determined, dynamic and climb the corporate ladder by bringing our true authentic selves at work. 

I see this reflected in my daily work life from our senior leadership’s commitment to setting the tone for inclusivity and respectfulness. Here, we prioritize inclusivity from the corporate policy making level to the celebration of diversity. 

This is evident in team meetings where everyone's voice is heard, and diverse perspectives are welcomed and valued, fostering an environment where collaboration thrives. Additionally, Gallagher's employee resource groups offer platforms for networking and support, further contributing to a workplace where differences are celebrated and everyone feels empowered to contribute their best.

stories.headline: David DeVito - GB Investigator - Background, Technical expertise and A day in the Life of

latest_response.question: What are your main responsibilities as a GB Investigator?
latest_response.answer: My main responsibilities as a GB investigator are to conduct full investigations related to insurance fraud including, but not limited to, surveillance and activity checks, Upon completion of the investigations, a comprehensive written report is submitted and any evidence, such as video documentation, is uploaded as well. As needed, I will testify at New York and New Jersey State Court civil trials and Workers’ Compensation Board hearings, while working closely with attorneys, insurance claim representatives, and other professionals in the industry. My daily responsibilities as a surveillance investigator are to manage my caseload, work independently in the field, and conduct surveillance.

stories.headline: 5 Ways Female Visibility in Construction is Benefiting the Workplace

latest_response.question: Can you share a personal experience where being a female in construction had a positive impact?
latest_response.answer:
Have to ponder that as I feel I've given multiple examples of how my gender has positively flavored the impact I've made in my profession, my interactions with my staff and clients, my approach, communication style, and perspective.

Not sure I have one that is solely due to my gender but will loop back to add to this if I'm able to identify something of value to share.

written.content:
Breaking Barriers: A Woman's Journey in Construction Safety
Written by: Lara McNicol
As a female executive in the field of construction safety, I've witnessed firsthand the positive changes that have taken place in this traditionally male-dominated industry over the past three decades. 
From starting out as a young professional woman surrounded by male colleagues and managers to now leading a pri

stories.headline: Candidate Objections

latest_response.question: Can you tell us about what an average week looks like?

video.transcribe_text: So a normal kind of day for me is I start off by just reviewing my emails. Uh it's kind of a nice way to kind of start, uh, it gives you any updates on kind of any work that you've been doing, any kind of cases that you need to be focusing on. Uh, we also have a morning meeting, um, during this time we kind of get updates on any kind of changes or updates that are kind of happening, um, maybe some specific cases that we need to focus on throughout the day. Um, then we just kind of go straight into casework for the rest of the day. Um, most days are kind of similar in the sense of there's not much change to that routine. Uh, for me, the main kind of, um, changes that are happening is it's the kind of work that I do, um, because no day is kind of the same. Uh, you are doing very different cases throughout each day, and there are lots of different pension schemes. So you're kind of doing, you might be doing the same kind of case from, like, the day before, but it's for a different pension scheme, so you kind of need to know a whole bunch of other kind of different information.

stories.headline: Growth for the go-getter: Entrepreneurial Spirit

latest_response.question: Imagine you had an unlimited budget to kick-start a new project or idea at Gallagher—what would you launch first, and what would be your pitch? | If your entrepreneurial journey at Gallagher were a startup, what would you name it and why?
latest_response.answer: I would invest heavily in training and development and providing incentives to our people, so they feel valued.  A people centric approach is the only way to create sustained success - from basic training to leadership development to mentorships to collaborating with external trainers to helping our managers become better people leaders.  Investing in our people builds loyalty and confidence and makes for more effective succession planning. This initiative would enhance our company's culture, attract top talent, and ultimately lead to innovative solutions that meet client needs and drive business growth.

stories.headline: Growth for the go-getter: Innovation_Justin Brown

latest_response.question: What challenges did you face during the innovation process, and how did you champion them?
latest_response.answer: Vendor Management Systems are truly transformational platforms for an enterprise like Gallagher, but they also impact a lot of different areas. It's a services platform which means Procurement needs to be involved; it's an access management platform which means our identity management teams need to be involved; it's a financial platform which means our finance and AP need to be involved; it's a people platform, so it requires oversight from HR and Compliance; and finally we need to have involvement from various technology stakeholders to build all of the integrations required. Additionally, the need to include various cross divisional stakeholders to define all of our use cases. Overall, I would say one of our biggest challenges was ensuring that all of the relevant stakeholders had the appropriate resourcing and dedicated focus on this project.  We championed these challenges by establishing a clear communication plan that outlined the project's scope, goals, and timelines for all stakeholders. Regular meetings were held to ensure alignment and address any concerns or roadblocks. We also created a cross-functional team with representatives from each department to ensure that all perspectives were considered and integrated into the solution. By fostering a collaborative and inclusive environment, we were able to successfully navigate the complexities of the innovation process and drive the project forward towards successful implementation.

stories.headline: Uncovering the Benefits of Inclusion and Diversity in Businesses

latest_response.question: How does a diverse and inclusive workforce drive innovation and competitive advantage in the marketplace?

video.transcribe_text: we have built intentional practises to ensure all our employees feel valued, respected and included. Here at Gallagher, we are making great progress towards having a diverse representation in our leadership roles and decision making processes. A great example of this is the wonderful A and D Council, for which my amazing colleague Hannah Harriman chairs along with myself as deputy chair. We have recently hosted an extremely educational training session on unconscious bias. We consider using inclusive language and different ways to communicate with our colleagues. For example, teams calls email and taking team members out for coffee chats. We utilise our internal communications newsletter Pulse with what is going on in our council, our work streams and social committees so that our coworkers can keep up to date and feel informed within their own time. Our leadership are committed to nurturing our A and D culture.

stories.headline: A Career in Environmental Consulting at Gallagher Bassett

latest_response.question: Can you explain the importance of data analysis and interpretation in environmental consulting?
latest_response.answer: Data analysis and interpretation is the real trick of consulting. Anyone can set up meters and pumps, take picture, write notes, observations and collect mountains of data. But what do you do with it? How can you take this mountain and turn it into an actionable report with conclusions, recommendations and solutions that a lay person can understand. The key is to sift the data and pick out the pieces that are relevant to the project at hand. If we are performing exposure monitoring, then we want to look at the compounds that approach the action levels indicating that a potential hazard could exist. If we are performing a building inspection then we want to know locations where potential hazards may exist and compare that to places where occupants frequent. But most importantly we want to prepare a written report that allows an end user with little to no experience in the field to comprehend and understand the purpose or objective as well as the conclusions and recommendations of the final report. We as consultants are no good to our clients if we cannot relay the information to them in a manner that they can understand and convey to others. In my opinion that is what separates and environmental scientist from an environmental consultant. Scientists collect data, consultants take that data and manipulate it into an end user document.

stories.headline: Navigating the future together: Early careers - interns to FTEs_Naomie DiMartino

latest_response.question: How has your perception of Gallagher evolved from when you were an intern to now as a full-time employee?
latest_response.answer: My perception of Gallagher has changed significantly from when I first interned. I wasn't able to scratch the surface on how many different services are provided by the company. There are so many various roles to explore at Gallagher whether it's within the GGB/GBS/RPS/Gallagher Re divisions or being a Risk Management consultant for your client. When I had first interned, I thought that there was only route for me to pursue and as I have grown in my role, my manager has made it clear that she will provide me with the support needed to be successful in the niche of my choice. This support and flexibility have allowed me to see Gallagher in a whole new light, not just as a company that provides insurance services, but as a place where individual growth and development are truly valued.

stories.headline: The Unwavering Gallagher Way: Commitment to Excellence_Abhilash Candran

latest_response.question: Have you faced any challenges in maintaining high standards, and how did your innovative-thinking approach help in championing them?
latest_response.answer:
Yes I have faced few challenges while maintaining the high standards such as consistency, adaptation, limitation of resources and different stakeholder management. 

When I say consistency, to me it is ensure that I give high quality standard work-day in and day out, but maintaining it across the team and projects can be difficult especially in a large organization like Gallagher.

Adaptation is also one of the major aspect when new technologies or applications are introduced in the organization, maintaining high standards can be difficult because it depends on how quickly we adapt to the change not only as an individual but it also depends on how the entire team or organization adapts to it as well. I faced this challenge when iCIMS was introduced In our organization, its been more than a year and I still find new things to learn now as well

Limitation of resources also plays a crucial role in maintaining high standards as sometimes we do not get the full information from the stakeholders on how things work from their point of view. Sometimes when we get a quick turn around time to complete a project, we may face the challenge to whether to try complete the task as soon as possible or complete the task with quality and without any errors or mistakes

Stakeholder Management is also important as they are responsible for providing the information. Sometimes due to hierarchy, we might miss out on few important calls and might not receive the entire information and only receive the filtered  data from our superiors.

My Innovative thinking solved these challenges by 

Problem Solving - It encourages us to creative solutions to overcome resource limitations and barriers
Collaboration - It helps us in building team work and provides us an opportunity to share best practices, insights and different innovative ideas
Continuous Improvement - For maintaining the high standards, we will have the mindset of improving ourselves and learn new things everyday to grow as per the organization and the industrial needs

So to conclude, by having innovative thinking you not only maintain the high standards but it also helps in elevating the organizations standards as well

stories.headline: Navigating the future together: Team Collaboration and Support_Alex Abhari

latest_response.question: What’s one unexpected skill you’ve developed by collaborating with cross-functional teams?
latest_response.answer: Learning different areas that I might not support and learning that side in order to be stronger and support my current stakeholders when they have questions. It really helps to be "global" within a global organization in areas that you might support a bit but to ensure the processes go smoothly from start to finish whether you support an area or not. This has allowed me to build stronger relationships with colleagues in different departments and gain a deeper understanding of how our work interconnects. By being able to step in and offer assistance or guidance in areas outside of my expertise, I have become a more versatile and valuable team member. This unexpected skill has not only improved my own knowledge and capabilities but has also fostered a culture of collaboration and support within our cross-functional teams. It has truly been a rewarding experience to navigate the future together with my colleagues, leveraging our collective strengths to achieve our shared goals.

stories.headline: Resolution Associates - question set

latest_response.question: What do you feel is the key to success in the role?

video.transcribe_text: The key to being a successful resolution associate definitely has to do with time management and organizational skills. But you also need to have the confidence in yourself and not be afraid to ask any questions or your coworkers for help.

stories.headline: Growth for the go-getter: Innovation_Melissa Horwich

advocates.role: Senior Manager, Talent Acquisition Global Support

latest_response.question: How has your innovative idea impacted your team (or the organization as a whole)?
latest_response.answer: My idea to take a team and make it global has not only created new roles and opportunities within TA, but it has led to the true global support of recruitment. We are able to go into new geographies or acquired businesses, and our scalability model has allowed us to meet the growing demands of the business. We have taken on the added responsibilities of maintaining compliance policies and finance requirements on requisitions and offers, allowing us to become a trusted partner with other functions of HR.  Additionally, our innovative approach has improved the overall efficiency of our recruitment processes, reducing time-to-fill metrics and increasing the quality of candidates we bring in. By leveraging technology and data analytics, we have been able to identify trends and patterns in our hiring practices, allowing us to make data-driven decisions that have positively impacted our team's performance. Overall, our innovative idea has transformed the way we operate, fostering a culture of continuous improvement and growth within the organization.

stories.headline: Perk and benefits

latest_response.question: Are there any specific perks or incentives that would attract you to a job opportunity?
latest_response.answer:
I wish client service team members were given the opportunity to earn carrier incentive trips. We are a huge part of renewing existing business and even deciding where to place new business.
It would also be really nice to get a reimbursement for my cell phone or home internet since I use those items much of the day for work-related things.

I'd recommend anyone interested in the role. Do some research before the interview, have an understanding of the role and come with some questions during the interview. Be sure to provide examples that demonstrate your experience and that would translate to the role.

advocates.role: Senior Manager, Talent Acquisition Global Support

latest_response.question: If you could create any new tool or technology or process as an ‘idea maker’ in your role at Gallagher, no matter how wild or futuristic, what would it be and why?
latest_response.answer: Setting aside the need to segregate our non-employee workforce from our employee population to avoid concerns of co-employment, it would be ideal to capture all candidates regardless of how they have come to know about Gallagher so they can be nurtured and considered for all of our staffing needs. Currently, our reliance on vendors for temporary workers minimizes our ability to influence the candidate experience, in addition to adding a profit layer for our vendors increasing Gallagher's cost.

stories.headline: Navigating the future together: Early careers - interns to FTEs

latest_response.question: What is the one piece of advice you would give future interns about championing their internship experience?
latest_response.answer:
One piece of advice for interns is to ask questions and challenge yourself. It's really the only way to get better in my opinion. When assigned a task, I would recommend clarifying with whoever assigned the task two things:

1) what exactly they want done
2) how they want it done
 
Now depending on what it is, there may not be as much room for error. For example, if I was working on an active document in the branch's shared drive, maybe I would make a copy and work on that one, just in case I made a 'big' mistake. This allows you to challenge yourself with less stress while completing the task. I recommend trying to complete the task to the best of your ability and then take it to whoever assigned you the task so they can spot check your work. After interning for two consecutive summers, I believe that struggling a little is actually very beneficial because the mental breakthrough in realizing mistakes or the more efficient way of completing the task is much more significant and it sticks with you. My only tip on all this is don't sit there for an hour struggling, I would say maximum 15-20 minutes of being stuck on one thing, ask for help! This is what the internship is for...you definitely will get out of it what you put into it.

stories.headline: Navigating the future together: Team Collaboration and Support (INDIVIDUAL)

latest_response.question: If your team were a superhero squad, what would each member’s superpower be, and how would it contribute to your team's success?
latest_response.answer: Our superhero powers would be controlling the weather and weathering the storm essentially. Getting through difficult situations is truly what we do and have been faced with many challenges but ensure we get better and better together.

stories.headline: The Unwavering Gallagher Way: Commitment to Excellence

latest_response.question: Have you faced any challenges in maintaining high standards, and how did your innovative-thinking approach help in championing them?
latest_response.answer:
Yes I have faced few challenges while maintaining the high standards such as consistency, adaptation, limitation of resources and different stakeholder management. 

When I say consistency, to me it is ensure that I give high quality standard work-day in and day out, but maintaining it across the team and projects can be difficult especially in a large organization like Gallagher.

Adaptation is also one of the major aspect when new technologies or applications are introduced in the organization, maintaining high standards can be difficult because it depends on how quickly we adapt to the change not only as an individual but it also depends on how the entire team or organization adapts to it as well. I faced this challenge when iCIMS was introduced In our organization, its been more than a year and I still find new things to learn now as well

Limitation of resources also plays a crucial role in maintaining high standards as sometimes we do not get the full information from the stakeholders on how things work from their point of view. Sometimes when we get a quick turn around time to complete a project, we may face the challenge to whether to try complete the task as soon as possible or complete the task with quality and without any errors or mistakes

Stakeholder Management is also important as they are responsible for providing the information. Sometimes due to hierarchy, we might miss out on few important calls and might not receive the entire information and only receive the filtered  data from our superiors.

My Innovative thinking solved these challenges by 

Problem Solving - It encourages us to creative solutions to overcome resource limitations and barriers
Collaboration - It helps us in building team work and provides us an opportunity to share best practices, insights and different innovative ideas
Continuous Improvement - For maintaining the high standards, we will have the mindset of improving ourselves and learn new things everyday to grow as per the organization and the industrial needs

So to conclude, by having innovative thinking you not only maintain the high standards but it also helps in elevating the organizations standards as well

stories.headline: TST Manager questions

latest_response.question: What does the first month look like in the Transition Service Team including training?

video.transcribe_text: The transition service team is an amazing support team for the clients of Gallagher Bassett. As a member of the team, you will spend the first two weeks going through training, which consists of our claims technical on boarding, coupled with supervisor mentor training. The first two weeks is designed to get you acclimated with the Gallagher Bassett system and the best practices to prepare you for your s your assignment. At the end of the second week, you along with your supervisor will have a meet and greet with the client of your assignment to review the expectations, the service instructions and the nuances of the assignment. The goal is to ensure that you are prepared to take on the disk. Once you begin to receive claims, we will continue to support you and provide the necessary guidance and resources to ensure your success in the position.

stories.headline: TST videos

latest_response.question: What about Gallagher Bassett and our Transition Service Team opportunity convinced you to come and work with us?

video.transcribe_text: I started my journey at Gallagher as a contract employee. And soon after I was offered the opportunity to join the transition service team. Um After I learned what the responsibilities would be, I eagerly accepted, it not only allowed me to transition into a permanent position with Gallagher, but it also gave me the chance to continue assisting injured workers and supporting my team members in branch whenever I was needed. Despite not being in a dedicated desk role, I believe this allows me to bring even more value to the company and enhance my claims knowledge. Additionally, the fact that Gallagher is one of the top TPAS in the industry combined with the opportunity to work remotely, makes this an even more appealing opportunity.

stories.headline: From a construction job to an on-site safety professional. Rubi's Career Journey

latest_response.question: How do you collaborate with construction teams and management to promote a culture of safety?
latest_response.answer: I collaborate with construction teams and management by holding regular safety meetings where we address concerns and set safety goals together. Open communication is key, so I encourage a transparent, two-way dialogue for reporting hazards and sharing suggestions. I involve both teams in developing safety plans that are practical and effective, ensuring everyone is on the same page proactively. Recognizing and rewarding safe practices helps reinforce the importance of safety. I also provide continuous feedback and make adjustments based on team input, while ensuring that management visibly supports and enforces safety initiatives to lead by example.

stories.headline: How I Advanced My Desktop Investigation Career with Gallagher

latest_response.question: Can you share a memorable success story from your time at Gallagher?
latest_response.answer: The most memorable so far was probably my promotion to Desktop Division Manager. It took time and effort but it all paid off. I am proud to have been chosen to manage a team that I grew with. Being in this role, allows me to continue being a team player and work day in and day out with everyone. It brings joy to know I am helping my team and clients with anything they may need. Smaller but still memorable, is when I was chosen as Investigator of the Year, twice. Working hard, continuous learning, and being a team player truly aides in personal and professional success.

stories.headline: US interns role insight

latest_response.question: What was your proudest moment in this role?

video.transcribe_text: My proudest moment in this role was probably when I gave my final Monday morning meeting speech, the topic of that speech was why Gallagher should hire you. And it was in front of my peers, it was in front of Gallagher employees that made those hiring decisions. And it kind of put all my public speaking training and all of my work towards becoming comfortable being uncomfortable to the test. And I put a lot of hard work into creating and practicing this speech. And so when I finished and um saw everyone in the room clapping and got great feedback. I was very proud of myself.

A Day in the Life: Navigating Challenges and Balancing Work in Claims Investigation
Ever wondered what it takes to keep things running smoothly in the world of claims investigation? It's a job that's all about being on your toes, ready for whatever the day throws at you. For anyone with a knack for solving puzzles and an eye for detail, this could be the role for you. 


You don't need to be a sup

stories.headline: My journey in [Industry] has been very different to most people

latest_response.question: How do you balance the need for innovation and creativity with the importance of stability and reliability in [Industry]?
latest_response.answer:
A few years back I purchased a new car with Apple Car Play, collision detection and collision avoidance.  They were also a few other bells and whistles as well that made operating it more enjoyable and safer.  However after all those additions it was still a car and the skills I learned to operate it still held true after several decades since I received my driver's license.  The same as with my career. I hold on to the fundamentals I learned over the years.  However being innovative and constantly being on the lookout to make a process even better than before has kept me at the forefront of the industry.  

Gallagher supports those who bring innovation and creativity to the job.   In my journey in EHS, I have found that balancing innovation and creativity with stability and reliability is crucial. It's important to stay up-to-date with the latest technologies and trends, while also maintaining a strong foundation of reliable and proven methods. This balance has allowed me to adapt to changing circumstances and continuously improve my work, while also ensuring that I can deliver consistent and dependable results. It's a delicate dance, but one that has been essential to my success in the industry.

written.content:
Charting Success in the Industry: Stories of Innovation, Resilience, and Growth
When it comes to the industry, we're all part of a bigger story, a narrative filled with innovation, constant learning, and the need to stay on our toes. I've been around for a while, witnessed how things have shifted and turned. Whether it was embracing the tech wave or tackling new regulatory beasts, the journey was

stories.headline: How I Advanced My [Industry] Career with Gallagher

latest_response.question: What do you consider the most valuable thing you've ever done for [FIELD]?
latest_response.answer:
One of the most valuable contributions I've made to the safety field is the development and implementation of comprehensive safety programs for high-risk projects. By creating detailed safety protocols and conducting extensive training, I have significantly reduced the incidence of accidents and injuries on construction sites.

Additionally, my work in emergency response planning has been particularly impactful. By establishing first responder teams and conducting regular drills, I have ensured that all personnel are prepared to handle emergencies effectively. These initiatives have not only improved safety outcomes but have also fostered a culture of safety and preparedness within the organizations I've worked with.

My document management practices have been appreciated by the Department of Buildings (DOB), Gallagher management, statutory authorities, and clients. I have consistently maintained and updated safety documents, ensuring they are accurate and readily available for inspection. This meticulous approach has enhanced compliance and streamlined safety management processes.

I approach management and workers with respect, while being strict and adhering to policies. Treating my coworkers as a family, I emphasize the importance of safety and ensure everyone understands and follows safety protocols. This balance of respect and strict adherence to safety standards has created a positive and effective safety culture.

My ability to predict upcoming hazards through experience and teamwork has been crucial. I provide advance notifications and ensure excellent communication about potential hazards and changes in environmental conditions. I make sure that any critical information reaches everyone by personally talking to them, messaging their direct numbers, and emailing the group.

Above all, I believe that the most valuable thing I have contributed to the safety field is the preservation of life. Every action I take, from implementing safety protocols to conducting training and emergency drills, is aimed at protecting the lives of workers. Ensuring that everyone goes home safely at the end of the day is my highest priority and greatest achievement. This dedication to preserving life has driven me to continuously improve safety standards, foster a culture of vigilance and care, and make a lasting impact on the safety and well-being of all individuals involved in the projects I oversee.

written.content:
Navigating Safety Leadership: Lessons from the Front Lines
In an industry where the stakes are as high as the structures we create, mastering the art of safety is not just a responsibility—it's a calling. With over thirty years in the industry, I've weathered evolving regulations and the rigors of construction projects. Through it all, my focus has remained unerring: to ensure that each person on

stories.headline: Career Advice I'd give myself if I were studying now

latest_response.question: Can you share any insights on the importance of internships or practical experience in this field?
latest_response.answer:
Internships are invaluable in shaping your career trajectory. They provide real-world experience, allowing you to apply theoretical knowledge and discover your passions. My internships in accountancy and a boutique family office were pivotal in my journey. While I gained technical skills, I also realized these paths weren't for me. This self-awareness was crucial in making informed career choices.

Having a diverse range of work experiences is incredibly beneficial. Whether it's part-time jobs, volunteering, or internships, each experience contributes to your overall development. These experiences equip you with transferable skills such as problem-solving, adaptability, and communication. In interviews, drawing on these varied experiences demonstrates your versatility and ability to thrive in different environments. Ultimately, internships and practical experience are essential for building a strong foundation for your career.

stories.headline: How to Advance Your Career at Gallagher: Exploring [Name]'s Journey to Becoming a [Jon Role]

latest_response.question: Can you discuss the skills and qualities that helped Mike succeed in his journey to becoming a Southeast Regional Manager?
latest_response.answer:
The qualities and skills I look for in candidates and employees who was I hope I have used to get me to where I am now.  They include the following:

Dependibility/Reliability - Showing up on-time, every day
Communication Skills - Being able to look someone in the eye while talking.  Writing a concise, professional email.
Listening - Being a good listener is critical
Likeable - People need to like being around you
Technical Writing - It is important to be able to write in our business
Motivated - You have to be motivated to achieve success.  There are people who are content with where they are professionally
Adaptability - Being able to adjust to different situations and challenges
Leadership - Taking charge and guiding others in the right direction
Problem-Solving - Thinking critically and finding solutions to complex issues
Ethical - Upholding high moral and ethical standards in all aspects of work
Team Player - Collaborating effectively with colleagues and working towards common goals
Strategic Thinking - Planning and executing long-term strategies for success
Continuous Learning - Being open to acquiring new knowledge and skills to stay ahead in the industry

These are just a few of the skills and qualities that I believe have contributed to my success as a Southeast Regional Manager at Gallagher. I hope this insight helps you in your own career advancement journey.

written.content:
Humble Beginnings to a Remarkable Career at Gallagher: Field Tech to Regional Manager
Twenty-four years ago, the fresh college grad that stepped through Gallagher's doors didn't imagine that one day he'd be at the helm of the Southeast region. That's me, Mike, and my journey from a field technician to Southeast Regional Manager has been quite the ride, full of growth, sweat, and a fair share of ch

stories.headline: Day In The Life

latest_response.question: Can you tell us what a typical day looks like?
latest_response.answer: A typical day as a Site Safety Manager, I worked from 6am to 6:30 pm. I arrived on site and review any pending safety issues or incident from the previous day. Check messages to make sure that any urgent safety-related issues are corrected. Conducted site safety orientations with new employees to discuss the site safety rules and site requirements. After conducting the site safety orientations, I performed workplace inspections throughout the site to identify potential hazards, safety violations, non-compliance with safety regulations in which a report is generated and kept in a logbook as required by NYC Department of Buildings. All identified potential hazards, safety violations and non-compliance are related to the General Contractor and documented. I also investigate any reported accidents, injuries or near-miss incidents that occur in the workplace in which an incident report is prepared, and corrective actions are related to the contractor involved.

stories.headline: Gallagher [JobRole] Professional Development

latest_response.question: what challenges do you face in your day to day work?
latest_response.answer:
As a consultant in the Environmental/Health & Safety industry, the challenges I most commonly face relate to collecting accurate data, and effectively communicating with colleagues, clients, and regulators. 

Accurate data collection relies upon technical proficiency. Technical proficiency in turn relies upon possessing an underlying understanding of concepts and best practices, the tools/equipment of the trade, available resources, applicable standards and regulations, and the ability to draw on and apply that general body of knowledge to specific (varied) circumstances. To that effect, you can never be too experienced or too knowledgeable, and the path to self-improvement means embracing one's status as a perpetual student. 

The value of being an effective communicator shouldn't require much exposition. The ability to better communicate with clients or their employees, to understand their needs and/or concerns, to be able to effectively distill obscure technical concepts or standards, and clearly/concisely provide information and actionable advice are just a few examples of how such skills might prove useful or necessary.

written.content:
Nurturing Professional Growth: The Gallagher Bassett Way
At Gallagher Bassett Technical Services (GBTS), professional development isn't just a corporate buzzword; it's an integral part of our DNA, the Unwavering Gallagher Way. As a part of the team, my journey from a consultant " contractor to full-time professional hinges on the growth opportunities fostered here. Like a vessel charting unknown w

stories.headline: Hiring Managers Reveal: What Makes a Great Surveillance Investigator?

latest_response.question: Can you share a success story where your surveillance work led to a significant outcome?
latest_response.answer:
1- A construction worker sustained a verified and serious injury, with a demand of 30 million dollars. For approx. 5 years, we conducted surveillance which showed that each month, the claimant was making a significant and noticeable recovery. The value of the case is now 10 million (a 20 million dollar saving to the insurance carrier)
2- a dentist was on a train when it was involved in a serious crash. She initially needed a walker to ambulate. After a year, she needed a cane. The following year, she no longer needed the cane and no longer limped. Surveillance over a period of several years showed that she made great recovery which resulted in large saving for the insurance company.   3- In another case, a claimant alleged a permanent injury and was seeking a large settlement. However, our surveillance revealed that the individual was participating in high-impact sports and other physically demanding activities, completely contradicting their claim of being permanently disabled. This evidence led to a significant reduction in the settlement amount and saved the insurance company a substantial sum of money.

4- Additionally, we had a case where a claimant reported being unable to work due to a back injury. Through our surveillance work, we were able to capture footage of the claimant engaging in heavy lifting and other strenuous activities, proving that their injury was not as severe as they had claimed. This ultimately led to a denial of their disability claim and prevented the insurance company from paying out unwarranted benefits.

These success stories highlight the crucial role of surveillance investigators in uncovering fraudulent or exaggerated claims, ultimately saving insurance companies significant amounts of money while upholding the integrity of the claims process.

written.content:
Mastering the Art of Covert Surveillance: Insider Tips and Success Stories
Covert surveillance is one tricky business. It's like one of those old spy movies—sneaking around unnoticed, gathering intel without blowing your cover. But unlike the movies, this is real, and must be done correctly. You've got to think on your feet, be keenly aware of your surroundings, and most importantly, stay within t

And that just really helped. It made me feel a lot more, you know, comfortable walking in on that first day that I already knew my team members and that I wasn't a complete stranger to them.

latest_response.question: Can you discuss the importance of empathy and customer service in your role as a Property Claims Manager?
latest_response.answer: I've found that people are at their most vulnerable when they have a major loss.  They need to know you understand that. It starts at the top.  I can't expect my team to be empathetic to customers, if I'm not empathetic to them.  I have an open-door policy.  I trust my team and want them to be comfortable in communicating their concerns.  We listen first, are always mild and helpful with each other.  That translates to dealing with our clients' highest priority, their customers.

latest_response.question: Can you share a success story of how our TA Global support team went above and beyond to help a team member?
latest_response.answer: corrected an error on a job advert and helped the team member navigate through a challenging situation with a difficult client. Their dedication and quick thinking not only resolved the issue but also strengthened the team's trust and confidence in the support team's abilities. Their proactive approach and willingness to go the extra mile truly exemplify the exceptional level of support provided by our TA Global team.

stories.headline: The Power of Recruitment Marketing: How to Attract Top Talent in a Competitive Market

latest_response.question: What role does content marketing play in recruitment marketing, and how do you create engaging content for potential candidates?
latest_response.answer: Employee Generated Content! It's been growing over the last few years, and 2024 should be a bigger year again. What better way is there to get a message out than using your employees? To better engage candidates this could be done using video, or the more widely seen written blog. The biggest challenge with this is finding willing employees to put themselves out there.

written.content:
The Power of Recruitment Marketing: How to Attract Top Talent in a Competitive Market
Recruitment marketing is a critical aspect of talent acquisition that goes beyond simply posting job openings on various platforms. It involves crafting a comprehensive strategy to attract top talent and create a positive candidate experience. Yet, there are common misconceptions about recruitment marketing that need to be debunked. In this article, we will explore the multifaceted nature of recruitment marketing, the impact on candidate experience, the importance of quality job adverts, and how it contributes to building a diverse and inclusive workforce.
 
Recruitment Marketing: Beyond Job Boards
Recruitment marketing is often mistakenly associated with job boards or social media postings. However, it encompasses much more. It's about employer branding, content marketing, employee referrals, and candidate relationship management. A successful recruitment marketing strategy communicates the company's employer brand and engages potential candidates throughout their entire journey, from initial awareness to the application process. It requires strategic thinking and a deep understanding of the target talent pool.
 
Enhancing Candidate Experience with Recruitment Marketing
Recruitment marketing plays a vital role in improving the overall candidate experience. By crafting compelling job descriptions, employers can attract top talent and set the right expectations. Additionally, using employee-generated content in the form of videos or blogs can help engage candidates and provide authentic insight into the company culture. A positive candidate experience builds trust and strengthens the employer brand, leading to higher-quality applicants.
 
The Power of Quality Job Adverts
The quality of job adverts has a significant impact on the success of recruitment marketing efforts. Rather than solely relying on generic job descriptions, organisations should focus on creating compelling adverts that resonate with the target audience. Tailoring the messaging to the specific needs and aspirations of potential candidates increases the likelihood of attracting top talent. Additionally, placing the most impactful information at the beginning of the advert captures attention and generates interest.
 
Driving Diversity and Inclusion through Recruitment Marketing
Recruitment marketing is a powerful tool for fostering diversity and inclusion within the workforce. Simply relying on job boards is not enough; a comprehensive approach is required. Recruitment marketing strategies should aim to reach a diverse range of candidates by leveraging various channels and platforms beyond traditional job boards. By showcasing inclusive company values and promoting equal opportunities, organisations can proactively attract candidates from diverse backgrounds.
 
Utilising Content Marketing for Candidate Engagement
Content marketing is an integral part of recruitment marketing, enabling companies to create engaging materials for potential candidates. Employee-generated content is particularly effective in this regard. By featuring videos or written blogs created by employees, organisations can provide an authentic perspective of the company culture and working environment. The challenge lies in finding employees who are willing to share their experiences, but the impact of such content can be invaluable in attracting and resonating with potential candidates.

In conclusion, recruitment marketing is a multifaceted approach to talent acquisition that extends beyond job boards. By adopting a comprehensive strategy, prioritising candidate experience, crafting compelling job adverts, and leveraging content marketing, organisations can attract top talent while fostering diversity and inclusion. Embracing the true essence of recruitment marketing allows companies to elevate their employer brand and build a stronger workforce capable of driving innovation and success.
